body_html: Because it is reasonable to provide a mechanism for users to know when the process group has initialized. In old THD days, I used to log a line after init_process_group because it used to block until all processes reaches that call (at least for NCCL). In c10d, it becomes nonblocking. So I wanted to use a dist.barrier but NCCL doesn't support it.

body: Because it is reasonable to provide a mechanism for users to know when the process group has initialized. In old THD days, I used to log a line after `init_process_group` because it used to block until all processes reaches that call (at least for NCCL). In c10d, it becomes nonblocking. So I wanted to use a dist.barrier but NCCL doesn't support it.
